Aerosols (small particulate matter) play an important role in the atmosphere, impacting both air quality and climate. Recently I been exploring how advanced data analysis techniques such as machine learning can be used to improve the classification and characterization of aerosols measured in situ.

I published work on improving the classification of absorbing aerosols: Classification of iron oxide aerosols with a single particle soot photometer using supervised machine learning.

I have also been exploring deep learning approaches to classifying black carbon aerosol morphology and presented initial results as a paper at the Neurips 2019 Tackling Climate Change with AI Workshop: A deep learning approach for classifying black carbon aerosol morphology.
